results.title: Patrick
results.creator_credit: Australian International Film Corporation, Antony Ginnane, Richard Franklin and IFM Films
results.brief_description: Patrick, having murdered his mother and her lover, has become a polyplegic, pre-oedipal, psychotic lump. He has telekinetic powers, fancies his nurse and is hostile to his doctor. This is an entertaining mix of black humour and suspense with a few shocks. Cast includes Susan Penhaligon, Robert Helpmann and Rod Mullinar.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian International Film Corporation, Antony Ginnane, Richard Franklin and IFM Films

results.title: Patrick
results.creator_credit: Kratky Film, Weston Woods Studios, Morton Schindel and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon for children which tells the story of Patrick and of the magical things that happen when he plays his violin. Based on the book written and illustrated by Quentin Blake, and told without words. Sound montage by Gene Deitch. Animation by Milan Klikar and Bohumil Sejda. Colour and background paintings by Miluse Hluchanicova.

results.title: Patricia's moving picture
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Margaret Pettigrew, Ann Pearson, Kathleen Shannon and Bonnie Sherr Klein
results.brief_description: Deals with the problems and frustration’s many women feel when they find that being a wife and mother at home does not fully occupy their time, and who do not find the stimulation they need to fulfil their lives and feel useful. Patricia wants to be “an individual” to be independent rather than the wife of Mr. Garner. (Awards: Melbourne, New York)

results.title: Pathways to the Future Worker Co-Operatives in N.S.W.
results.brief_description: This film shows how worker co-operatives are established and maintained at both financial and managerial levels. The benefits to participants in the co-operative movement is also demonstrated

results.title: Pathways to Australian science: 2 thinking scientifically about crime
results.brief_description: Science - a specific way of thinking and acting, manifesting itself in the “scientific method” - allows legal personnel to reach the truth. Following the example of an arson case, this short documentary follows the process as police gather evidence, conserve evidence, conduct interviews, debrief, hypothesise and consult experts (in this instance a chemicals analysis expert) who will either prove or disprove their theories. At the heart of the investigation is experience, ideas and the importance of not assuming any presupposed truths. Also discusses the necessity of integrating changes in technology using DNA fingerprinting as a specific example.

results.title: Pathway into light
results.creator_credit: Royal National Institute for the Blind, Howard Thomas and Terry Ashwood
results.brief_description: Parisian tributes to Louis de Braille are shown as well as the opening of his Centenary Exhibition by the Duke of Edinburgh, early Braille punching machines, modern production methods, the library of the Royal National Institute for the Blind and various teaching methods. Commentary written by Lambton Burn and spoken by Jack Hawkins and Jean Metcalfe.

results.title: Paths to progress
results.brief_description: In Chiang Mai, the capital of Thailand, the Australian Development Assistance Bureau is working with the University’s Faculty of Agriculture in a highland Ergonomie project to help develop agricultural potential for some 80% of the Thai population living in small villages.

results.title: Pathfinder = Ofelas [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Norway Film Development Company A/S, Mayco, Norsk Film, John Jacobsen and Nils Gaup
results.brief_description: Amongst the Lapp people, this story has been passed on from generation to generation for almost a thousand years.. This is a beautifully produced and directed film about a Saami legend starring Saami actors, set in a stark but breathtaking location in Finland. Taking place a thousand years ago, the film opens dramatically. Sixteen-year-old Aigin (Mikkel Gaup) witnesses the slaughter of his family, including both his parents and his younger sister, by the brutal warrior Tchudes, a roaming tribe of warlike people. Aigin, who is fortuitous enough to escape the murdering Tchudes takes on an epic adventure from firstly seeking help and comfort from a neighbouring village, to unwittingly being captured by the invading Tchudes and finally, to heroically reaping vengeance on those who killed his family. This ancient legend vividly portrays the hard life of the Saami people, their customs, many of which still exist today, and director Nils Gaup (Vanishing frontier, 1993 documentary) conveys the story in a simplistic, honest, and at times confronting way. A most compelling film. Cast also includes John Sigurd Kristensen, Helgi Skulason, Svein Scharffenberg, Inger Utsi, Nils Utsi, Anne-Marja Blind. Nominated for Best Foreign Picture in the 1987 Oscar Awards.
